project.title: Afforestation Impact Modeling
project.problem_statement: Tree-planting projects need quantitative data on how much CO₂ they sequester over time, but calculating long-term sequestration and ecological impact is complex.

solution.description: Create a model in Python to estimate CO₂ capture by newly planted trees. Gather data on regional tree growth rates, carbon content of biomass, and survival rates. Simulate tree growth over 10–20 years to compute total carbon stored.
features: Scenario simulation for different planting strategies
Case studies: e.g., 'planting 1,000 teak trees will sequester X tons CO₂'

tasks: Obtain growth curves for target tree species
Write Python scripts to project biomass and carbon storage
Run simulations for various planting scales
Analyze species mixes and regional variations
Generate graphs of carbon uptake over time
Summarize findings for local government planners

project.impact_metric: Estimated metric tons of CO₂ sequestered over a 10–20 year timeline per 100 trees planted (by species and region).
deep_impact_possibility: Embedding into municipal or educational climate dashboards
